column4: your mbr is probably set to boot from usb, instead of main hard drive. I actually went through this last week during a fresh install
sh*t, i guess i am at a loss. I will keep searching thinking. What does it show for available devices? This a fresh install?
It shows the available devices as cd drive, network boot and HDD. Yes, its a fresh install.
No, I mean when running sudo fdisk -l
open a terminal and enter "sudo fdisk -l" and tell me what devices are shown
we are looking for your main partition /dev/sda(x)
which has the most blocks and what is listed under it's system
ok, enter sudo ms-sys -m /dev/sda2 and restart
yes, that is the same message I got when I did this last week and i proceeded
I know this problem/solution only from my experience, not from knowledge lol
I wasn't much help, but sure :)
